ai-tha-ap299:2.1_0: Having seen (him), I worshipped him with my feet.
ai-tha-ap299:2.3_0: having understood me with confident heart,
ai-tha-ap299:3.3_0: After bringing him to the charnel ground,
ai-tha-ap299:3.4_0: I’ll rejoice in heaven for an eon.’
ai-tha-ap299:4.1_0: On the two occasions when the other goes forth
ai-tha-ap299:4.2_0: Whatever place he was anywhere else,
ai-tha-ap299:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap299:4.4_0: this fruit is the fruit of deed.
ai-tha-ap299:6.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja.
